passages.text: FY2025 Nippon Shinyaku (4516, Neutral, Seiji Wakao) Viltepso - Type C meeting with the FDA: Nippon Shinyaku plans to hold discussions with the FDA on maintaining early approval of Viltepso. We expect the share price to react positively if early approval status is maintained.

2H 2025 Kyowa Kirin (4151, Neutral, Seiji Wakao) Rocatinlimab ROCKET- ASCEND (Ph3, adult & child, monotherapy, Q8W) interim analysis: We intend to focus on the profile of efficacy, which has been a concern, in a scenario of long- term administration. Expectations for surpassing Dupixent and Ebgyss are down, so we feel any share price decline could be limited even if efficacy is lower.

August 29 (Friday) Preliminary July watch movement production statistics (Consumer Electronics sector, Junya Ayada): We focus on this data as an indicator of demand trends in the low- priced watch market. June production volume, which was announced last time, increased \(6\%\) YoY, and end- of- month inventory volume was down \(5\%\) YoY.

August 31 (Sunday) Eisai (4523, Neutral, Seiji Wakao) Decision on Leqembi SC- AI maintenance therapy approval (PDUFA date): Approval is the consensus view, and we do not expect a major change in the sales trend from approval for maintenance therapy.

September 1 (Monday) July CIPA digital camera and interchangeable lens data (Electronics sector, Junya Ayada/Mio Shikanai; estimated date): In the previous announcement, June shipment volume increased \(19\%\) YoY and shipment value rose \(10\%\) YoY. Mirrorless camera shipment value was up \(8\%\) for the third consecutive monthly increase. In contrast, interchangeable lens shipment value was down \(3\%\) YoY for the fourth consecutive monthly decline.

September 1 (Monday) Suzuki Motor (7269, Overweight, Akira Kishimoto) MSIL monthly sales volume announcement: While we think end- user retail demand will face temporary buying restraint following the Indian government's notice on reduction of the goods and services tax (GST), we expect inventory restocking ahead of the demand period to drive domestic volume growth on a factory- shipment basis. August has fewer factory operating days, but we think shipments should exceed normal seasonality with support from the new Kharkhoda plant's transition to two- shift operation.

September 4 (Thursday) US monthly sales volume announcement (Autos/ Auto Parts sector, Akira Kishimoto) (September 3 local time): We intend to focus on the sustainability of demand momentum. In July, SAAR temporarily recovered to around 17 million units on strengthened sales promotions by OEMs. For August, we will watch rebalancing of incentives and sales volume amid the steady arrival of vehicles with marked- up prices, including annual price revisions, at dealers. In particular, we will watch the
sustainability of Subaru's sales momentum following its aggressive price hikes.

- September 5 (Friday)-10 (Wednesday) Takeda Pharmaceutical (4502, Neutral, Seiji Wakao) World Sleep 2025 - expecting detailed announcement of TAK-861 (Narcolepsy Type 1) Ph3 (First Light, Radiant Light) data: We think the market is likely to react positively if the data confirm an attractive profile, similar to Ph2b.

- September 5 (Friday) Kirin Holdings (2503, Neutral, Satoshi Fujiwara) Meeting for sell-side analysts: At the 1H results briefing, CEO Yoshinori Isozaki explained that Kirin Holdings will move forward with business reorganization and return profits obtained from selling businesses to shareholders. We intend to focus on management's approach to business reorganization.

- September 5 (Friday) Shiseido (4911, Neutral, Akiko Kuwahara) Meeting for sell-side analysts: We intend to confirm top-line growth policy as well as management's views on pricing strategy in Japan, structural reforms in North America, and the next medium-term plan.

- September 6 (Saturday) WSTS global semiconductor market statistics - July data announcement (Semiconductor sector, Mio Shikanai): Global semiconductor sales for June, announced last time, rose 18% YoY and 7% MoM.

- September 8 (Monday) Eisai (4523, Neutral, Seiji Wakao) World Sleep 2025: E2086 (orexin receptor agonist, narcolepsy type 1) Ph1 Proof of mechanism trial top-line results: If the announcement confirms favorable results, we think the share price is likely to react positively.

- September 9 (Tuesday) Suzuki Motor (7269, Overweight, Akira Kishimoto) Technical strategy briefing/September 10 (Wednesday) Kosai factory tour: Suzuki plans to hold a briefing on technology strategy with a 10-year horizon, as it did last year. Last year, Suzuki introduced weight reduction for automobile bodies, its strength, and battery-lean electrification technology, but it has not presented a clear roadmap for realization. At this year's event, we intend to focus on progress since last year and production technology innovation. In the factory tour scheduled for the next day, we will focus on Suzuki-style efforts to improve production efficiency and the role of the Japanese mother factory targeted in the 2030 medium-term plan and the model case for overseas rollout.

- September 10 (Wednesday) Pola Orbis Holdings (4927, Underweight, Akiko Kuwahara) Meeting for sell-side analysts: We will focus on management's comments regarding progress in stabilization of the POLA brand customer base, assessment of the B.A. brand renewal, and long-term growth measures.

- September 10 (Wednesday) Chinese monthly sales volume announcement (Autos/Auto Parts sector, Akira Kishimoto) (estimated date): Demand concentrated in August 2024 with the start of replacement purchase subsidies from the Chinese government in July 2024, so we expect weak YoY sales volume in August 2025. We will watch the strengthening of sales promotions by auto OEMs ahead of the end of the subsidy at year-end and narrowing of the purchase tax exemption. We think Toyota and Nissan should sustain relatively upbeat sales momentum thanks to solid sales of BEV models for the Chinese market.

- September 18 (Thursday) Swiss watch August export data announcement (Consumer Electronics sector, Junya Ayada): We focus on this data as an indicator of demand trends in the high-priced and high-end watches market. July export value announced last time was up 7% YoY.

- September 19 (Friday) SCSK (9719, Neutral, Matthew Henderson) Briefing on synergies with Net One Systems: While the market has high expectations for synergies, they already added around ¥1 billion to orders in 1Q FY2025, and we expect the share price to react positively if management presents quantitative targets and other details.

- September 19 (Friday) Kao (4452, Overweight, kiko Kuwahara) Cosmetics business strategy briefing: Executive Office Tomokuchiyama, who became head of the cosmetics business in January 2021, will speak. We will focus on measures aimed at converting the cosmetics field, and are where Kao has been struggling, into a growth driver.

- September 22 (Monday) JEMA consumer electronics equipment domestic shipment data announcement (Consumer Electronics sector, Junya Ayada): We focus on this data as an indicator of demand trends in the domestic consumer electronics market. July shipment value, announced last time, fell 2% YoY. Room air conditioners rose 4% YoY for the fourth consecutive monthly increase.

- September 24 (Wednesday) Kose (4922, Neutral, Akiko Kuwahara) Meeting for sell-side analysts: We want to confirm progress in domestic cost reduction and management's view on returns from overseas marketing investments. We also need to confirm the possibility of further M&A activity.

- September 25 (Thursday) Konami Group (9766, Overweight, Junko Yamamura) "SILENT HILL f" release: This title is an entirely new installment in the series set in Japan. We forecast sales of 1.8 million units and ¥4.5 billion in operating profit in the release quarter (we expect the release in 3Q).

- September 25 (Thursday) August cement supply/demand data announcement (Cement sector, Mio Shikanai): July results announced previously were domestic cement sales volume at 2.85 million tons (down 5% YoY), export volume at 780,000 tons (up 5% YoY), and period-end inventory down 8% versus the previous month-end.
JPMorgan Securities Japan Co., Ltd. Japan Research AC

Companies Discussed in This Report (all prices in this report as of market close on 27 August 2025, unless otherwise indicated) Eisai (4523)(4523. T/4,621/N), KONAMI GROUP (9766)(9766. T/4,391/N)

Analyst Certification: The Research Analyst(s) denoted by an "AC" on the cover of this report certifies (or, where multiple Research Analysts are primarily responsible for this report, the Research Analyst denoted by an "AC" on the cover or within the document individually certifies, with respect to each security or issuer that the Research Analyst covers in this research) that: (1) all of the views expressed in this report accurately reflect the Research Analyst's personal views about any and all of the subject securities or issuers; and (2) no part of any of the Research Analyst's compensation was, is, or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed by the Research Analyst(s) in this report. For all Korea- based Research Analysts listed on the front cover, if applicable, they also certify, as per KOFIA requirements, that the Research Analyst's analysis was made in good faith and that the views reflect the Research Analyst's own opinion, without undue influence or intervention.

All authors named within this report are Research Analysts who produce independent research unless otherwise specified. In Europe, Sector Specialists (Sales and Trading) may be shown on this report as contacts but are not authors of the report or part of the Research Department.

outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.

Among the Non Registered Ratings, with respect to those credit ratings provided by S&P Global Ratings (S&P), Moody's Investors Service (Moody's), or Fitch Ratings (Fitch), prior to making investment decision based on such Non Registered Ratings, please carefully read the "Explanation Letter regarding Non Registered Ratings" for the corresponding credit rating agency, which we separately have sent or will send.

Legal entity responsible for the production and distribution of research: The legal entity identified below the name of the Reg AC Research Analyst who authored this material is the legal entity responsible for the production of this research. Where multiple Reg AC Research Analysts authored this material with different legal entities identified below their names, these legal entities are jointly responsible for the production of this research. Where more than one legal entity is listed under an analyst's name, the first legal entity is responsible for the production unless stated otherwise. Research Analysts from various J.P. Unless otherwise stated below in the legal entity disclosures, this material has been distributed by the legal entity responsible for production, or where more than one legal entity is listed under the analyst's name, the first legal entity will be responsible for distribution. If you have any queries, please contact the relevant Research Analyst in your jurisdiction or the entity in your jurisdiction that has distributed this research material.
